page.title: 02Houses & people in Chickney
page.content: Size of church affirms larger population in past: decimated by plague 1665. Now sparsely inhabited area: 300 persons and 100 dwellings 95 in good conditionb and family occupied. Summary: 1 Elizabethan manor, 14 farmhouses - mostly 16th- 18th C and 1 part 14th C (5 now private homes with gardens and a small field), many small brick and tiled dwellings and wattle and daub and thatched cottages, 1 Victorian schoolhouse and 1 old forge now converted as dwellings, some modern dwellings, bungalow and chalet type and 3 cedar wood houses. Residents, native and newcomer, like living in old houses confirmed by well preserved condition of buildings. An evident commitment to work and activities gives area a lively & prosperous air.
